          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price she can resell for a profit. She is currently preparing to make an offer.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price she can resell for a profit. She is currently preparing to make an offer.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he wandered away from his father's apple orchard, drawn by the melody of a traveling musician's flute. He followed the sound for what felt like hours, his small legs aching, until he reached a bustling marketplace filled with exotic sights and smells. The vibrant colors and unfamiliar faces filled him with a sense of wonder, and he vowed to one day see the world beyond his village.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he helped his father sell apples at the local market. He was fascinated by the art of bargaining, watching his father expertly negotiate prices and build rapport with customers. Cedric, a natural charmer, found himself drawn to the social aspect of commerce, his young mind already dreaming of a life of travel and trade.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he overheard his father lamenting the loss of a prized apple tree, struck down by a sudden storm. Cedric, filled with a sense of responsibility, spent days researching grafting techniques and meticulously nursed a sapling back to health. The experience instilled in him a deep respect for nature's bounty and a determination to overcome adversity.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he secretly sold some of his father's apples at a neighboring village, using the profits to buy himself a worn map of the world. The thrill of independence and the allure of the unknown fueled his desire to break free from the confines of his predictable life.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he finally confronted his father about his yearning to travel. The conversation ended in a heated argument, leaving Cedric feeling misunderstood and resentful. He packed his meager belongings, a knapsack filled with apples and dreams, and set off into the world, determined to prove himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a seasoned merchant who taught him the intricacies of the fruit trade. He learned about different varieties, their growing seasons, and the art of preserving them for long journeys. Cedric, a quick learner, absorbed the knowledge like a sponge, his passion for fruit blossoming into a lifelong pursuit.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins.
          Time
        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 4.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 4.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 1.0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '2 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer for the fruit or reject it and try to negotiate a different price.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he wandered away from his father's apple orchard, drawn by the melody of a traveling musician's flute. He followed the sound for what felt like hours, his small legs aching, until he reached a bustling marketplace filled with exotic sights and smells. The vibrant colors and unfamiliar faces filled him with a sense of wonder, and he vowed to one day see the world beyond his village.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he helped his father sell apples at the local market. He was fascinated by the art of bargaining, watching his father expertly negotiate prices and build rapport with customers. Cedric, a natural charmer, found himself drawn to the social aspect of commerce, his young mind already dreaming of a life of travel and trade.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he overheard his father lamenting the loss of a prized apple tree, struck down by a sudden storm. Cedric, filled with a sense of responsibility, spent days researching grafting techniques and meticulously nursed a sapling back to health. The experience instilled in him a deep respect for nature's bounty and a determination to overcome adversity.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he secretly sold some of his father's apples at a neighboring village, using the profits to buy himself a worn map of the world. The thrill of independence and the allure of the unknown fueled his desire to break free from the confines of his predictable life.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he finally confronted his father about his yearning to travel. The conversation ended in a heated argument, leaving Cedric feeling misunderstood and resentful. He packed his meager belongings, a knapsack filled with apples and dreams, and set off into the world, determined to prove himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a seasoned merchant who taught him the intricacies of the fruit trade. He learned about different varieties, their growing seasons, and the art of preserving them for long journeys. Cedric, a quick learner, absorbed the knowledge like a sponge, his passion for fruit blossoming into a lifelong pursuit.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who buys fruit from farms and resells it at the market, aiming to make a profit. He successfully negotiated a sale with Della Plumstone for two coins.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer for the fruit or reject it and try to negotiate a different price.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to try and negotiate a higher price with Lennon Figtree.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:00:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who buys fruit from farms and resells it at the market, aiming to make a profit. He successfully negotiated a sale with Della Plumstone for two coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer for the fruit or reject it and try to negotiate a different price.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to try and negotiate a higher price with Lennon Figtree.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree could accept Cedric Meadowbrook's offer for the peaches, counteroffer with a lower price, or walk away from the negotiation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed their father, a struggling farmer, being taken advantage of by a wealthy landowner. The landowner offered a pittance for their father's finest apples, exploiting his desperation. Lennon watched, powerless and furious, as their father accepted the unfair deal, his shoulders slumping under the weight of circumstance. The injustice of it all burned into Lennon's memory, fueling a growing distrust of others.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they started helping their mother sell apples at the local market. Lennon quickly learned the art of haggling, but they took a perverse pleasure in shortchanging customers, especially those who seemed arrogant or entitled. It was a small act of rebellion, a way to exert control in a world that often felt stacked against them.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they overheard villagers gossiping about their family, whispering about their poverty and their father's misfortunes. The words stung like salt in a wound, leaving Lennon feeling isolated and embittered. They vowed to prove those gossipers wrong, to amass a fortune and show them all that they were not to be pitied.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they left home to become a traveling fruit merchant. They traveled from town to town, their cart laden with apples, pears, and plums, each piece of fruit a potential weapon in their arsenal of petty revenge. Lennon relished the anonymity of the road, the freedom to exact their own brand of justice on unsuspecting customers.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of merchants who tried to cheat them out of a good deal on a shipment of oranges. Lennon, however, had learned from the best, and they outsmarted the merchants, driving a hard bargain and walking away with a profit. The victory, though small, filled Lennon with a sense of satisfaction, reinforcing their belief that the world was a battlefield and they were determined to win.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:00:00.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree could accept Cedric Meadowbrook's offer for the peaches, counteroffer with a lower price, or walk away from the negotiation.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to counteroffer with a lower price.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they left home to become a traveling fruit merchant. They traveled from town to town, their cart laden with apples, pears, and plums, each piece of fruit a potential weapon in their arsenal of petty revenge. Lennon relished the anonymity of the road, the freedom to exact their own brand of justice on unsuspecting customers.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of merchants who tried to cheat them out of a good deal on a shipment of oranges. Lennon, however, had learned from the best, and they outsmarted the merchants, driving a hard bargain and walking away with a profit. The victory, though small, filled Lennon with a sense of satisfaction, reinforcing their belief that the world was a battlefield and they were determined to win.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:00:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market, hoping to resell them for a profit in her hometown. They are currently negotiating a price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market.           [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree could accept Cedric Meadowbrook's offer for the peaches, counteroffer with a lower price, or walk away from the negotiation.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to counteroffer with a lower price.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 5 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 5 coins
      Context for action selection and components

      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree can either accept Cedric Meadowbrook's counteroffer or make a new offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they overheard villagers gossiping about their family, whispering about their poverty and their father's misfortunes. The words stung like salt in a wound, leaving Lennon feeling isolated and embittered. They vowed to prove those gossipers wrong, to amass a fortune and show them all that they were not to be pitied.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they left home to become a traveling fruit merchant. They traveled from town to town, their cart laden with apples, pears, and plums, each piece of fruit a potential weapon in their arsenal of petty revenge. Lennon relished the anonymity of the road, the freedom to exact their own brand of justice on unsuspecting customers.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of merchants who tried to cheat them out of a good deal on a shipment of oranges. Lennon, however, had learned from the best, and they outsmarted the merchants, driving a hard bargain and walking away with a profit. The victory, though small, filled Lennon with a sense of satisfaction, reinforcing their belief that the world was a battlefield and they were determined to win.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make a new offer.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 1 coin
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (b)

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon offering four coins for the fruit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Cedric Meadowbrook's counteroffer or make a new offer.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make a new offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 5 coins or reject it.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he finally confronted his father about his yearning to travel. The conversation ended in a heated argument, leaving Cedric feeling misunderstood and resentful. He packed his meager belongings, a knapsack filled with apples and dreams, and set off into the world, determined to prove himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a seasoned merchant who taught him the intricacies of the fruit trade. He learned about different varieties, their growing seasons, and the art of preserving them for long journeys. Cedric, a quick learner, absorbed the knowledge like a sponge, his passion for fruit blossoming into a lifelong pursuit.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Scene 6 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are fine peaches. You know I wouldn't bring you anything less. Two coins a kilogram and we have a deal.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are fine peaches. You know I wouldn't bring you anything less. Two coins a kilogram and we have a deal.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are fine peaches. You know I wouldn't bring you anything less. Two coins a kilogram and we have a deal.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are fine peaches. You know I wouldn't bring you anything less. Two coins a kilogram and we have a deal.
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree can negotiate a price with Della Plumstone for the fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to negotiate a price with Della Plumstone.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree tried to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook but was unsuccessful and is now attempting to sell fruit to Della Plumstone.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they started helping their mother sell apples at the local market. Lennon quickly learned the art of haggling, but they took a perverse pleasure in shortchanging customers, especially those who seemed arrogant or entitled. It was a small act of rebellion, a way to exert control in a world that often felt stacked against them.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they left home to become a traveling fruit merchant. They traveled from town to town, their cart laden with apples, pears, and plums, each piece of fruit a potential weapon in their arsenal of petty revenge. Lennon relished the anonymity of the road, the freedom to exact their own brand of justice on unsuspecting customers.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can negotiate a price with Della Plumstone for the fruit.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to negotiate a price with Della Plumstone.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Two coins? Now Lennon, you know I've been a loyal customer for years. Surely you can do better than that for me.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Two coins? Now Lennon, you know I've been a loyal customer for years. Surely you can do better than that for me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are prime quality. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Three coins? You're dreaming, Lennon. Two and a half, and that's my final offer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Della, you know these apples are the finest in Fruitville. Two coins is a fair price.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit too.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, these are prime peaches, worth every copper.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Cedric, you know I always pay a fair price, but four coins is my best offer.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are fine peaches. You know I wouldn't bring you anything less. Two coins a kilogram and we have a deal.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Two coins? Now Lennon, you know I've been a loyal customer for years. Surely you can do better than that for me.
    Active player

      Name
